name: Folder

properties.name: alias
properties.description: When true, the object refers to a file system alias or shortcut.

properties.name: created
properties.description: The creation date of the referenced folder, or null if the object does not refer to a folder on disk.

properties.name: error
properties.description: A message describing the most recent file system error.

properties.name: exists
properties.description: When true, this object refers to a folder that currently exists in the file system.

properties.name: fsName
properties.description: The platform-specific name of the referenced folder as a full path name.

properties.name: fullName
properties.description: The full path name for the referenced folder in URI notation. .

properties.name: absoluteURI
properties.description: The full path name for the referenced folder in URI notation.

properties.name: relativeURI
properties.description: The path name for the referenced folder in URI notation, relative to the current folder.

properties.name: modified
properties.description: The date of the referenced folder's last modification, or null if the object does not refer to a folder on disk.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The folder name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the path specification.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: The localized name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced folder, without the path specification.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The path portion of the object absolute URI for the referenced file, without the folder name.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: TThe Folder object for the folder that contains this folder, or null if this object refers to the root folder of a volume.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Attempts to resolve the file-system alias or shortcut that this object refers to.

parameters.name: newName
parameters.description: The new folder name, with no path information.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Deletes the folder associated with this object from disk immediately, without moving it to the system trash.

methods.name: changePath
methods.description: Changes the path specification of the referenced folder.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A string containing the new path, absolute or relative to the current folder.

methods.name: getRelativeURI
methods.description: Retrieves and returns the path for this file, relative to the specified base path, in URI notation.

parameters.description: A base path in URI notation.
parameters.name: basePath

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Opens this folder in the platform-specific file browser (as if it had been double-clicked in the file browser).

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Converts this object to a string.

methods.name: toSource
methods.description: Creates and returns a serialized string representation of this object.

methods.name: selectDlg
methods.description: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, and creates a new File or Folder object for the selected file or folder.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

methods.name: getFiles
methods.description: Retrieves the contents of this folder, filtered by the supplied mask.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: A search mask for file names, specified as a string or a function.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a folder at the location given by this object's

properties.name: fs
properties.description: The name of the current file system.

properties.name: current
properties.description: A Folder object for the current folder.

properties.name: startup
properties.description: A Folder object for the folder containing the executable image of the running application.

properties.name: appPackage
properties.description: In Mac OS, a Folder object for the folder containing the bundle of the running application.

properties.name: system
properties.description: A Folder object for the folder containing the operating system files.

properties.name: trash
properties.description:
A Folder object for the folder containing deleted items. On Windows, the trash folder is a virtual
								   folder containing a database; therefore, the property value is null on Windows.

properties.name: temp
properties.description: A Folder object for the default folder for temporary files.

properties.name: userData
properties.description: A Folder object for the folder containing the user's application data.

properties.name: appData
properties.description: The folder containing the application data for all users.

properties.name: commonFiles
properties.description: A Folder object for the folder containing common files for all programs installed by the user.

properties.name: myDocuments
properties.description: A folder pointing to the user's My Documents folder.

properties.name: desktop
properties.description: A Folder object for the folder that contains the user’s desktop.

description: Represents a file-system folder or directory in a platform-independent manner.
